title: ID Stamp type, looks like a distressed Impact
content:
Hi

This font is one from an archive of fonts we have (it’s called ’StampComp’). It’s perfect for my title on front cover of a book, but I’ve discovered there are no apostrophes, hyphens or colons so I can’t really use it throughout the book for chapter headings.

(I have a funny feeling it was an amateur experiment because it looks like impact with a distressed stamp effect).

Does anyone know where I can find a full set of this font (I’ve tried the usual suspects like myfonts with no luck), or suggest a good alternative?

Many thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [stamp\_sample.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090710050356/http:/typophile.com/files/stamp_sample_0.jpg) | 109 KB |
author: dinkus

comments.content: Your best option is to use the typeface you want, and add a [stamp effect](http://web.archive.org/web/20090710050356/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/tip-the-wornweatheredstamped-look/).

[Misprinted Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20090710050356/http:/www.misprintedtype.com/v3/fonts.php) also carries some distressed fonts and Photoshop brushes.

And [Bittbox](http://web.archive.org/web/20090710050356/http:/www.bittbox.com/category/freebies/) has some free Illustrator and Photoshop brushes.
Thanks for those tips - all very helpful!
